it.polimi.se2019.client.gui

Class GUIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.client.gui.GUIController

  • public class GUIController
extends java.lang.Object
    The GUIController is the main gui controller, it intializes all the graphic elements from their fxml files. Then it provides all the methods for game rendering and player input building.
    Author:
    andreahuang

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GUIController()

      The setActionUnitButton method is used to give behaviour to an action button based on the list of action units of a weapon.

      The showGrabbableCards method shows the objects that are grabbable from the player's position in the map.

      The showMap method calls methods provided by the mapController to render the kill shot track, the players, the ammo crates, and the weapon crates.

      The showMyCards method shows the client player's weapon and power up cards.

      The showMyLoadedWeapons method shows the player's loaded weapons for selection, and hides the unloaded ones.

      The showMyPowerups method shows all the player's powerUps for selection.

      The showMyUnloadedWeapons shows the player's unloaded weapons for selection, and hides the loaded ones.

      The showPlayerBoards method shows the player board on the board.

      The showPowerUps method shows only the requested powerUps for selection.

      The showRanking method shows the player's ranking with their scores.

      The showScore method shows a player's score.

      The storeMessage method is used store the message received from the server.

    • Method Detail

      • setView

        public void setView(GUIView view)
        The setView method is called by the main application to set itself and give access to the model for linking.
        Parameters:
        view - is the view that interacts with the server.

      • init

        public void init()
        The init method initializes all the graphic parameters of the game using support methods.

      • setInfoPaneStyle

        public void setInfoPaneStyle()
        The setInfoPaneStyle method sets the style of info panes.

      • setInfoText

        public void setInfoText(java.lang.String info)

      • initMap

        public void initMap()
        The initMap method the map by loading the fxml containing the decorated map.

      • showMap

        public void showMap()
        The showMap method calls methods provided by the mapController to render the kill shot track, the players, the ammo crates, and the weapon crates.

      • initPlayerBoards

        public void initPlayerBoards()
        The initPlayerBoards method initializes the players' boards by loading them from the fxml file.

      • showPlayerBoards

        public void showPlayerBoards()
        The showPlayerBoards method shows the player board on the board. It is called on every update to refresh the interface.

      • initMyCards

        public void initMyCards()
        The initMyCards method initializes the player's power up and weapon cards to respond to mouse click events.

      • showMyCards

        public void showMyCards()
        The showMyCards method shows the client player's weapon and power up cards. It is called on every update to refresh the interface.

      • showScore

        public void showScore(Player player,
                      javafx.scene.control.Label score)
        The showScore method shows a player's score.
        Parameters:
        player - can be either the client or an opponent.
        score - is the label containing the player's score.

      • showName

        public void showName(Player player,
                     javafx.scene.control.Label name)
        The showName method shows the player's name.
        Parameters:
        player - can be either the client or an opponent.
        name - is the label containing the name of the player.

      • showAmmo

        public void showAmmo(Player player,
                     javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
        The showAmmo method shows the player's ammo.
        Parameters:
        player - can be either the client or an opponent.
        gridPane - is the grid pane containing the ammo images and text.

      • showOpponentUnloadedWeapons

        public void showOpponentUnloadedWeapons(Player player,
                                        int i)
        The showOpponentUnloadedWeapons shows the opponents' unloaded weapons.
        Parameters:
        player - is an opponent player.
        i - the i-th player in the right half of the window.

      • showActionButtons

        public void showActionButtons()
        The showActionButtons show the buttons to the action tile according to player's color and game's current mode.

      • showRanking

        public void showRanking()
        The showRanking method shows the player's ranking with their scores. It only allows exit from the game.

      • showCurrentPlayer

        public void showCurrentPlayer()
        The showCurrentPlayer method shows the current player's name.

      • handleClose

        public void handleClose()
        The handleClose method handle the close event when the close button is clicked.

      • handleConfirm

        public void handleConfirm()
        The handleConfirm method handles the mouse click event on the confirm button, it prepares the interface to receive the next input. Finally, it sends the input and refreshes the interface calling the cancel button.

      • handleCancel

        public void handleCancel()
        The handleCancel method handles the mouse click event on the cancel button, it refreshes the interface to a state prior to the input selection.

      • handleReset

        public void handleReset()
        The handleReset method handles the refreshing of the interface.

      • storeMessage

        public void storeMessage(java.lang.String message)
        The storeMessage method is used store the message received from the server. It is necessary to implement the action cancelling functionality.
        Parameters:
        message - is the message received from the server

      • getPlayerBoardControllerList

        public java.util.List<PlayerBoardController> getPlayerBoardControllerList()
        Getter for the list of the player boards' controller.
        Returns:
        list of player boards' controller

      • getPlayerBoardController

        public PlayerBoardController getPlayerBoardController(PlayerColor playerColor)
        Getter for the player board corresponding to the player's color.
        Parameters:
        playerColor - the player's color associated to the board
        Returns:
        the player board with the correct player color

      • getIntermediateInput

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getIntermediateInput()
        The getIntermediate input is the getter for a cache for the player input. It is forwarded to the view only once the whole action has been performed.
        Returns:
        the map built as input to send to the server

      • setCardSelectionBehavior

        public void setCardSelectionBehavior(javafx.scene.image.ImageView iv,
                                     javafx.scene.Node myCards,
                                     java.lang.String action,
                                     java.lang.Runnable additionalBehaviour)
        The setCardSelectionBehavior method gives a basic behaviour to an image view, and then adds additional behaviour only when necessary.
        Parameters:
        iv - is the image view on which to set a behaviour.
        myCards - is the container of the image view, and is disabled when the image view is clicked.
        action - is the string action that is used as key for input building
        additionalBehaviour - is a Runnable used to add some additional behaviour to the mouse click event

      • addInput

        public void addInput(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.String id)
        The addInput method receives a key string and an id string to build the input.
        Parameters:
        key - is the string used as key for input building.
        id - is the string used as value for input building.

      • handleM

        public void handleM()
        The handleM method asks a tile input from the player when the 'm' is clicked.

      • handleMG

        public void handleMG()
        The handleMG method asks a tile input and a card input from the player when the 'ms' button is clicked.

      • handleS

        public void handleS()
        The handleMG method asks a tile input and a card input from the player when the 's' button is clicked.

      • handleR

        public void handleR()
        The handleR method asks a reload input from the player when the 'r' button is clicked.

      • handleMRS

        public void handleMRS()
        The handleMRS method asks a tile input, a relaod input, and a shoot weapon input when the 'mrs' button is clicked.

      • handleMS

        public void handleMS()
        The handleMS method asks a tile input and a shoot weapon input when the 'ms' button is clicked.

      • handlePass

        public void handlePass()
        The handlePass method directly sends a NOP(no operation) to the server to skip an action.

      • getTile

        public void getTile()
        The getTile method is used to ask a tile input for a move action to the player.

      • getShootTile

        public void getShootTile(java.lang.String playerAction,
                         int amount)
        The getShootTile method is used to ask a tile for a weapon shoot or powerUp action to the player.
        Parameters:
        playerAction - is either a shoot or a powerUp action.
        amount - is the amount of tile asked from by the action.

      • getTarget

        public void getTarget(java.lang.String playerAction,
                      int amount)
        The getTarget method is used to ask a player target for a weapon shoot or powerUp action to the player.
        Parameters:
        playerAction - is either a shoot or a powerUp action.
        amount - is the amount of tile asked from by the action.

      • getCard

        public void getCard()
        The getCard method is used to ask a card input for a grab action to the player.

      • getPowerUpForRespawn

        public void getPowerUpForRespawn()
        The getPowerUpForRespawn method is used to ask a power up for a respawn action to the player.

      • getReload

        public void getReload()
        The getReload method is used to ask a weapon card input for a reload action to the player.

      • getShootWeapon

        public void getShootWeapon()
        The getShootWeapon method is used to ask a weapon card input for a shoot weapon action to the player.

      • getActionUnit

        public void getActionUnit()
        The getActionUnit method is used to ask an action unit input for a shoot action to the player. It can ask either tiles or targets, even both, to activate the action unit of the weapon.

      • setActionUnitButton

        public void setActionUnitButton(javafx.scene.control.Button b,
                                java.util.List<ActionUnit> actionUnitList,
                                int i,
                                java.lang.String weaponID)
        The setActionUnitButton method is used to give behaviour to an action button based on the list of action units of a weapon.
        Parameters:
        b - is the button on which to set the behaviour.
        actionUnitList - is the list of action units that asks tile or player target inputs.
        i - is index of the action in the action unit list.
        weaponID - is the id of the weapon that is performing the action unit.

      • handlePlayerSelected

        public void handlePlayerSelected(java.lang.String playerActon,
                                 java.lang.String color)
        The handlePlayerSelected method is used to add a player target input to a player action.
        Parameters:
        playerActon - is the playerAction for which to add the input.
        color - is the input to add for the player action.

      • setUpProgressBar

        public void setUpProgressBar(int numOfTargets)
        The setUpProgressBar method sets up the number of circles indicating the max number of selections allowed.
        Parameters:
        numOfTargets - is maximum number of selections.

      • showGrabbableCards

        public void showGrabbableCards()
        The showGrabbableCards method shows the objects that are grabbable from the player's position in the map. The grabbable cards can be either ammo crate or weapon crates. In case the player already has three cards in his or her hand.

      • showMyUnloadedWeapons

        public void showMyUnloadedWeapons()
        The showMyUnloadedWeapons shows the player's unloaded weapons for selection, and hides the loaded ones.

      • showMyLoadedWeapons

        public void showMyLoadedWeapons()
        The showMyLoadedWeapons method shows the player's loaded weapons for selection, and hides the unloaded ones.

      • showMyPowerups

        public void showMyPowerups(java.lang.String playerAction)
        The showMyPowerups method shows all the player's powerUps for selection.

      • showPowerUps

        public void showPowerUps(java.util.List<java.lang.String> powerUpList)
        The showPowerUps method shows only the requested powerUps for selection. It shows the requested powerUps and hides the others ones.
        Parameters:
        powerUpList - is the list of powerUps that are asked for input.

      • getAmmo

        public void getAmmo()
        The getAmmo method shows the player's ammo for selection. It is needed when a targeting scope powerUp is used.

      • resetAmmoStyle

        public void resetAmmoStyle()
        The resetAmmoStyle method resets the style of the player's ammo.

      • showPass

        public void showPass()
        The showPass method enables the pass button selection to skip an action.
